title: Iran says potential energy, mining and aircraft deals on table in talks with US
byline: Iran is pursuing a nuclear agreement with the U.S. that delivers economic benefits for both sides, an Iranian diplomat was reported as saying on Sunday, days before a second round of talks between Tehran and Washington.

title: BASL members to refrain from appearing for court cases today
byline: Members of the Bar Association of Sri Lanka (BASL) are refraining from appearing before courts island-wide on behalf of any cases today (16).

title: 2025 O/L examination to begin tomorrow at over 3,500 centres
byline: The 2025 G.C.E. Ordinary Level (O/L) Examination is scheduled to commence tomorrow (17).

title: State universities face 50% lecturer shortage; Crisis worsens at Rajarata University
byline: The Students’ Union of the Faculty of Management at the Rajarata University says that there is an approximately 50% shortage of lecturers and professors within the state university system, adding that the issue has become particularly severe at the Rajarata University.

title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the island
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in Central and Uva provinces and in Ampara, Batticaloa and Hambantota districts, today (16), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: 5,000 police officers deployed for India-Pakistan T20 World Cup clash in Colombo
byline: Around 5,000 police officers, including intelligence officers, have been deployed to ensure the safe conduct of the 2026 T20 World Cup match between India and Pakistan at the R. Premadasa International Cricket Stadium in Colombo.

title: IMF chief Kristalina Georgieva to arrive in Sri Lanka today
byline: Kristalina Georgieva, Managing Director of the International Monetary Fund (IMF), is scheduled to arrive in Sri Lanka today (16).

title: Train services on Colombo–Puttalam line resume following cyclone Ditwah disruptions
byline: Train services on the Colombo–Puttalam railway line, which were suspended due to the damage caused by the Cyclone Ditwah, have resumed earlier this morning (16).

title: ‘Women must step forward to carry forward the change we have begun’ - PM
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that no one will be allowed to drag the country’s future backward by inciting racism, and emphasized that women must step forward to carry forward the change that has been initiated.

title: Tamil Nadu CM urges PM Modi to solve citizenship issues of 89,000 Sri Lankan Tamils
byline: With just two months to go for the Tamil Nadu Assembly elections, Chief Minister MK Stalin has written to Prime Minister Narendra Modi seeking a “humane and pragmatic” resolution to the long-pending citizenship issue and legal status of Sri Lankan Tamils living in the state for over four decades.

title: President Dissanayake pays last respects to late Prof. Tissa Vitarana
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has paid his final respects to the late veteran politician and former minister, Professor Tissa Vitarana.

title: Leaders gather for New Delhi AI summit as warnings grow over societal risks
byline: A global artificial intelligence summit kicks off in New Delhi on Monday with big issues on the agenda, from job disruption to child safety, but some attendees warn the broad focus could diminish the chance of concrete commitments from world leaders.

title: Parcel containing live ammunition, SIM cards recovered in Wattala
byline: A parcel containing live ammunition has been taken into custody by the police in the Gaala Junction area in Wattala.

title: Three including woman arrested at BIA with over 16 kg of ‘Kush’
byline: Three individuals, including a woman, have been apprehended at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) by the Airport Police Narcotics Division in Wellampitiya while in possession of over 16 kilograms of ‘Kush’ narcotics.

title: ‘Wuthering Heights’ dominates global box office with $82 million, ‘GOAT’ scores $47.6 million worldwide
byline: “Wuthering Heights” was No. 1 at the global box office with $82 million, ranking as the top worldwide debut of the year.

title: Case against Namal Rajapaksa over ‘Krrish’ deal adjourned
byline: The Colombo High Court has ordered the postponement of the case filed against Member of Parliament Namal Rajapaksa regarding the controversial ‘Krrish’ project deal until February 19.

title: Modi to visit Israel soon for key talks with Netanyahu
byline: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will visit Israel later this month as the two countries seek to further deepen bilateral ties in key areas, especially defence, agriculture and counter-terrorism, official sources confirmed on Sunday.

title: GMOA to withdraw from health data reporting from Feb. 18
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) has announced its decision to withdraw from the reporting of health data with effect from February 18.

title: US conducts first air transport of nuclear microreactor in bid to show technology’s viability
byline: The U.S. Departments of Energy and Defense on Sunday for the first time transported a small nuclear reactor on a cargo plane from California to Utah to demonstrate the potential to quickly deploy nuclear power for military and civilian use.

title: Special announcement for 2025 O/L exam candidates
byline: The Commissioner General of Examinations, A. K. S. Indika Kumari Liyanage, has urged candidates sitting for the 2025 G.C.E. Ordinary Level (O/L) Examination to pay close attention to the official examination timetable.

title: 25 Indian fishermen arrested by Sri Lanka Navy
byline: Twenty-five Indian fishermen have been arrested by the Sri Lankan Navy while allegedly fishing in Sri Lankan high seas in the Palk Strait earlier this morning (16).

title: Apple’s cheapest MacBook with iPhone chip to launch in March
byline: Apple’s most affordable MacBook in years could be just weeks away.

title: UK Deputy PM David Lammy to visit Sri Lanka tomorrow to strengthen bilateral ties
byline: The Deputy Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, David Lammy is scheduled to arrive in Sri Lanka tomorrow (17).

title: Wild New Zealand storm disrupts transport, leaves thousands without power
byline: Heavy rain and strong winds disrupted flights, trains and ferries, forcing the closure of roads across large parts of New Zealand’s North Island on Monday, while snapping power links to tens of thousands.

title: Over 800 prisoners currently on death row in Sri Lanka - Ministry
byline: A total of 817 local and foreign individuals who have been sentenced to death are currently held in prisons across the country, the Ministry of Justice and National Integration has stated.

title: Asgiri Anu Nayake Thero calls for calm amid criticism of Buddhist clergy
byline: Members of the Buddhist clergy should respond with equanimity to allegations directed at them by certain sections of society, the Anu Nayake of the Asgiri Chapter, Most Venerable Narampanawa Ananda Thero stated.

title: Police inspection in Tissamaharama: 23 school buses and 3 vans deemed unfit for road use
byline: School buses and vans transporting students to Tissamaharama were subjected to a sudden inspection by police, authorities said.

title: Lawyers stage protest march over killing of lawyer and wife in Akuregoda
byline: A protest march has been staged today (16) by a group of lawyers led by the President of the Bar Association of Sri Lanka (BASL) over the murder of a lawyer and his wife in Akuregoda, Thalangama last week.

title: Two brothers arrested in Kottawa in relation to Akuregoda murders
byline: Two brothers have been arrested in Kottawa for allegedly aiding and abetting the killing of a lawyer and his wife in Akuregoda, Thalangama last week.

title: IMF chief Kristalina Georgieva arrives in Sri Lanka
byline: Kristalina Georgieva, Managing Director of the International Monetary Fund (IMF), has arrived in Sri Lanka a short while ago (16).

title: Govt. announces minimum purchase prices for paddy
byline: The government has officially announced the minimum prices at which the Paddy Marketing Board (PMB) will purchase paddy from farmers.

title: Cricket fans flew in 15 private jets to witness yesterday’s India-Pakistan match in Colombo
byline: A large number of cricket fans from around the world landed at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) on 15 private jets to witness the India-Pakistan T20 World Cup match held in Colombo on 15 February 2026.

title: UNP warns killing of lawyer threatens integrity of legal system
byline: The United National Party (UNP), in a statement, said that the killing of Attorney-at-Law Buddhika Mallawaarachchi and his wife on Friday, 13 February 2026, in broad daylight, poses a serious threat to the integrity of Asia’s oldest Western-based legal system.

title: Asgiri Anunayake Thero calls for calm amid criticism of Buddhist clergy
byline: Members of the Buddhist clergy should respond with equanimity to allegations directed at them by certain sections of society, the Anunayake of the Asgiri Chapter, Most Venerable Narampanawa Ananda Thero stated.

title: Buddhist monks from all chapters to be summoned to Colombo on Feb. 20
byline: Monks from all Buddhist chapters will be summoned to Colombo on 20 February to be briefed on actions being taken against the ‘Buddhasasana’, Ven. Dambara Amila Thero has announced.

title: Iran’s Revolutionary Guards begin military drills in Strait of Hormuz
byline: Iran’s Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps on Monday (Feb 16) began a series of military exercises in the Strait of Hormuz, state media reported on the eve of talks with the United States.

title: Prabath Chandrakeerthi named President’s Chief of Staff
byline: Prabath Chandrakeerthi has been appointed as the Chief of Staff to the President.

title: Massive fireworks store explosion in China kills eight ahead of Lunar New Year
byline: Eight people have been killed and two others suffered minor burns following an explosion and fire at a fireworks shop in eastern China.

title: Advisory for low pressure area in Bay of Bengal issued
byline: A low-pressure area has formed over the Bay of Bengal sea area to the south east of Sri Lanka, the Department of Meteorology stated.

title: Sri Lanka, Pakistan pledge deeper security collaboration
byline: Sri Lanka and Pakistan have decided to broaden collaboration between interior ministries, placing special emphasis on internal security coordination, counter-terrorism initiatives, and anti-narcotics operations.

title: New details emerge on Akuregoda double murder plot
byline: Two individuals, residents of Nawagamuwa, were arrested today (16) for allegedly transporting the firearm used in the double murder of a lawyer and his wife in Akuregoda, Thalangama and for facilitating the gunmen, police stated.

title: Pakistan has always supported Sri Lanka during difficult times: President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake emphasised that the Pakistan Interior Minister’s visit, together with the arrival of the Pakistan national cricket team in Sri Lanka, has further strengthened the long-standing friendship between Sri Lanka and Pakistan.

title: President Anura Kumara to leave for India tomorrow
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is scheduled to leave for India tomorrow (17) to attend the India AI Impact Summit 2026 in Delhi.

title: EU to take part in Trump’s Board of Peace but not as member
byline: The European Union will take part in this week’s inaugural meeting of United States President Donald Trump’s Board of Peace, but a spokesman insisted on Monday (Feb 16) that Brussels would not be joining as a member.

title: Sri Lanka’s PMI for January expands
byline: Sri Lanka’s Purchasing Managers’ Index (PMI) for January 2026 recorded growth in both manufacturing and services sectors.

title: Around 250 children die daily from cancer worldwide
byline: Around 250 children die globally each day from cancer, according to international health data.

title: February tourist arrivals surpass 150,000
byline: A total of 159,339 tourists have arrived in the country in the first 15 days of February, data from the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) shows.
